docs.snippet: The owner of a bus company in Gowanus, Brooklyn, who clashed with neighbors, is accused of hiring a man to burn down a potter’s studio....
docs.lead_paragraph: The owner of a bus company in Gowanus, Brooklyn, who clashed with neighbors, is accused of hiring a man to burn down a potter’s studio.
docs.abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column describes case surrounding attempted arson at artists' building in Gowanus, Brooklyn; some have blamed Abderraham Mouna, owner of bus company Executive Charters, who had clashed with neighbors over exhaust fumes and illegal dumping; Mouna and Jose Andujar, man he allegedly hired to set fire, remain in jail pending investigation into charges of arson and conspiracy.

headline.main: Simmering Tension on a Corner, and Then a Fire
headline.print_headline: Simmering Tension on a Corner, and Then a Fire
